intro: Elaeagnus longipes var. hortensis, commonly known as silverthorn, is a deciduous shrub characterized by its silvery-hairy leaves and small, yellowish flowers. It produces edible fruits that are typically consumed raw or cooked. The plant is native to China and thrives in well-drained soils, preferring full sun. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to fix nitrogen, enriching the soil. Its hardy nature makes it suitable for various climates and landscaping applications.
